translation: The nun asked why, and he told them, "The wine in my house is spoiled."

source_sentence: 尼曰：「何故不令變為好酒？」
translation: The nun asked, "Why isn't it made into good wine?"

source_sentence: 答言：「聖者！
translation: He replied, "Sage!

source_sentence: 我不曾解，仁有方法幸當惠施？」
translation: I have never understood, but is there a way that you, Sir, will be pleased to bestow?"

source_sentence: 尼曰：「少女！
translation: The nun said, "Young girl!

source_sentence: 我今年邁不復更為，昔在少時何事不解？」
translation: I'm not going to do anything more this year; what didn't I understand when I was young?"

source_sentence: 答言：「聖者！
translation: He replied, "Sage!

source_sentence: 憐愍我故變酒令好。」
translation: You kindly pity me and make me drink."

source_sentence: 尼言：「少女！
translation: The nun said, "Young lady!

source_sentence: 顧能與我美食之直，令汝酒好。」
translation: Please give me the straight path to good food, so that your wine will be good."

source_sentence: 答言：「多與。」
translation: He replied, "Give me plenty."

source_sentence: 尼曰：「可出酒瓮，我為瞻相。」
translation: The nun said, "You can take out the wine jar, and I'll look at its features."

source_sentence: 即便舁出，時吐羅尼上下觀瓮何因酒壞？
translation: He lifted it out, and the Tārāṇī looked up and down to see why the wine had broken out of the jar.

source_sentence: 乃知由熱。
translation: He then knew it was because of the heat.

source_sentence: 即開窓牖，令持濕沙安其瓮下，更取青苔繞瓮纏裹，扇去熱氣，因涼冷故酒便復好。
translation: He then opened the window, made them put wet sand under the urn, wrapped moss around the urn, fanned it to remove the hot air, and the wine was good again because it was cool.

source_sentence: 所有親族悉皆來集，時諸酒家咸悉備擬，怪不來取令人往問：「何不取酒？」
translation: When all the relatives had gathered, the taverns were all prepared, but when they didn't come to get it, they asked, "Why don't you get the wine?"

source_sentence: 報言：「我酒變好，無勞別取。」
translation: They replied, "My wine has become good, and there's no need to take it from anyone else."

source_sentence: 問言：「是誰教汝已壞之酒還令好耶？」
translation: He asked, "Who taught you to make good wine that had already been spoiled?"

source_sentence: 報言：「聖者！
translation: He replied, "Sage!

source_sentence: 吐羅難陀，於我有恩能為此事。」
translation: Tūrananda, you're kind to me and can do this."

source_sentence: 彼即譏嫌：「沙門釋女作非法事。
translation: They then criticized, "The ascetic and the Śākyamuni's daughter are doing something unlawful.

source_sentence: 云何奪我所作生業？」
translation: How did she take away the actions I did in order to be born?"

source_sentence: 苾芻白佛，佛言：「此非沙門釋女之法，理合譏嫌。
translation: The bhikṣu said to the Buddha, "This is not the teaching of the ascetic or the nun, and it's right to criticize it.

source_sentence: 是故諸尼不應教他變已壞酒。
translation: Therefore, nuns shouldn't teach others to spoil wine after transforming it.

source_sentence: 作者得吐羅底也罪。」
translation: That would be a sin for the person who did that to get rid of it."

source_sentence: 緣處同前。
translation: The situation was the same as before.

source_sentence: 時有長者樂為給施，身忽染患漸加困篤，自知形命將死不久，所有財物悉皆給施沙門、婆羅門、孤獨、乞人、善友、親族，唯有一舍猶未施他。
translation: An elderly man who was fond of giving alms suddenly became physically ill and gradually became more and more distressed, knowing that his life would soon be over, and he gave all of his possessions to ascetics, priests, orphans, beggars, good friends, and relatives, except for one offering that he hadn't yet given to others.

source_sentence: 時吐羅難陀苾芻尼聞來至家中，告言：「長者！
translation: When the monk Tūrananda heard this, he came to his house and told him, "Sir!

source_sentence: 凡諸女人利養寡薄，喜捨之次分惠少多。」
translation: Where women's benefits are few and far between, the preference for equanimity is small and generous."

source_sentence: 答曰：「聖者！
translation: They replied, "Sage!

source_sentence: 來遲，我之財物悉皆施盡，唯有此室。」
translation: I'm late, but I've given away all my possessions except this room."

source_sentence: 尼言：「長者！
translation: The nun said, "Sir!

source_sentence: 我本希望舉面而來，今遣空還不稱元意。」
translation: I had hoped to come here with my face raised, but now I've been denied emptiness and returned without claiming to be the original intention."

source_sentence: 報言：「聖者！
translation: They replied, "Sage!

source_sentence: 唯有此室，仁意欲將我終不惜。」
translation: 'Only this room is available, and I'd never hesitate to let you take me in.'

source_sentence: 尼曰：「若爾，我今便受，願除病苦。」
translation: The nun said, "If that's the case, I'll accept it now and wish to be freed from the pain of illness."

source_sentence: 後時長者遂便命過，諸親來集，以青黃赤白繒綵靈輿，送往屍林。
translation: After that, the elder then died, and his relatives gathered a blue, yellow, red, and white silken mantle and sent it to the corpse grove.

source_sentence: 時吐羅難陀苾芻尼，聞長者命終疾疾至彼，封閉其室立在一邊。
translation: When the Tūrananda nuns heard that the elder had died, they quickly went to him, sealed up his room, and stood to one side.

source_sentence: 時彼親族焚燒既畢，咸悉歸來見舍封閉，問言：「誰閉？」
translation: When their relatives had finished burning him, they all returned to see the house sealed up and asked, "Who closed it up?"

source_sentence: 尼曰：「其受施者，自來封閉。」
translation: The nun said, "The recipient of the gift will then seal it up himself."

source_sentence: 報言：「聖者！
translation: He replied, "Sage!

source_sentence: 施與何人？」
translation: To whom should I give it?"

source_sentence: 尼曰：「施我。」
translation: The nun said, "Give to me!"

source_sentence: 「聖者！
translation: "Sage!

source_sentence: 若爾，且賃與我，後酬價直。」
translation: If that's the case, then lease it to me, and I'll pay you a straight price later."

source_sentence: 尼曰：「虛實？」
translation: The nun said, "Is it real?"

source_sentence: 答言：「實與。」
translation: He replied, "It's true."

source_sentence: 尼即開門令入。
translation: The nun then opened the door and let them in.

source_sentence: 時有長者婆羅門來入其舍，聞如是事皆共譏嫌：「沙門釋女作斯非法，云何將屋賃與他人？」
translation: When an elderly brāhmaṇa came to enter his house, they all criticized him when they heard this, saying, "Why did the ascetic and Śākyamuni woman do this unlawful thing, and why did she lease her house to another person?"

source_sentence: 尼白苾芻，苾芻白佛，佛言：「非沙門女法，理合譏嫌。
translation: The nun said to the monk, and the monk said to the Buddha, "The monk said, 'That's not the way an ascetic or nun does, and it's right to criticize her.

source_sentence: 從今已去諸苾芻尼不應賃舍與人，賃者得越法罪。」
translation: From now on, monks and nuns shouldn't rent their living quarters to others, for it would be a transgression of the Dharma to rent them."

source_sentence: 緣處同前。
translation: The situation was the same as before.

source_sentence: 長者好施，知欲命終悉皆捨訖，唯有一鋪。
translation: The elder was a good donor, knowing that he wanted to spend his life in charity, and he had left only one shop.

source_sentence: 尼聞來乞事並同前，乃至身亡尼便封閉。
translation: The nun hears comes to ask for alms does the same thing as before, even after his death, and then the nun closes it.

source_sentence: 諸人嫌恥，苾芻白佛，佛言：「若賃鋪者得越法罪。」
translation: The people were disgusted, and the monk told the Buddha, who said, "If you take the bunk, you'll be guilty of transgressing the Dharma."

source_sentence: (恐煩故略)緣處同前。
translation: (Omitted for fear of trouble.) The place of reference was the same as the previous one.

source_sentence: 吐羅難陀尼入城乞食，見師巫女搖鈴繞家談說凶吉，多獲利物足得資身，即便念曰：「是好方便，我亦為之。」
translation: When the Tūranandana nuns went into the city to solicit alms, they saw a witch ringing a bell around their home, discussing good and bad fortune and obtaining enough profitable goods to support themselves.

source_sentence: 求得鈴已明旦入城，即巡諸家搖鈴振響，為他男女洗沐身形，詭說吉凶妄談來兆，有病患者天緣皆差。
translation: After obtaining the bell, he entered the city tomorrow morning and went around to the houses, ringing and ringing it, washing and cleaning the bodies of other men and women, and slandering them about good and bad fortune and talking falsely about omens, so that those who were sick would all have poor fortune.

source_sentence: 遂使王城之內咸共知聞，所有請祈無不啟竭，自餘巫卜人皆不問。
translation: As a result, the whole king's city was informed and heard, and all their prayers were unanswered, while the rest of the wizards and fortune tellers didn't ask about them.

source_sentence: 時舊醫巫詣諸人處，問言：「有事我為占相。」
translation: The old doctor-witch then went to the people and asked, "I'll divine your fortune if there's anything you want."

source_sentence: 諸人答曰：「更不勞汝，我有聖師善閑眾事，占相療疾皆悉稱心。」
translation: The people answered, "Don't bother, for I have a holy teacher who's good at taking care of many things and always satisfies me when I divine visions and treat illnesses."

source_sentence: 彼問：「是誰？」
translation: They asked, "Who is it?"

source_sentence: 答言：「聖者吐羅難陀！」
translation: He replied, "Sage Tūrananda!"

source_sentence: 彼聞譏恥作如是語：「非法釋女妄為巫卜奪我資生。」
translation: When they heard about this criticism, they said, "That's not right! The Śākyamuni woman is falsely divining as a witch and taking away my capital and livelihood."

source_sentence: 苾芻白佛，佛作是念：「尼作醫巫有如是過，妄為詭說招俗譏嫌。」
translation: The monks said to the Buddha, and the Buddha thought, "Such is the fault of a nun who acts as a doctor and witch, and she falsely teaches lies that invite criticism from the laypeople."

source_sentence: 告諸苾芻：「我今不許尼作醫巫，若有作者得越法罪。」
translation: He told the monks, "Now, I won't allow nuns to practice witchcraft, and if they do, they'll be guilty of transgressing the Dharma."

source_sentence: 根本說一切有部毘奈耶雜事卷第三十三
translation: Mūlasarvâstivāda-vinaya-kṣudraka-vastu, vol. 33
